HomeScene_FieldChangeDialog_Doctor_3:
Looks like you and this Snorlax
didn't do any sleep research
during your time together.
HomeScene_FieldChangeDialog_Doctor_4:
Now it’s time to pick this week’s
research site, so we’ll have to
say bye-bye here.
Home_AutoPickup_Popup_Desc:
Your Pokémon helped provide Snorlax
with some snacks while you were away.
It's grown even stronger!
Home_NoMoreSleepStartPopup_Message:
You can track up to two sessions of
sleep per day. You've hit today's limit.
Home_NoMoreSleepStartPopup_UnixtimeDupli:
You can't start tracking sleep right
now because your device's current
time overlaps with the time of a
sleep session you previously tracked.
For details, please consult the FAQ.
HomeScene_FieldChangeDialog_Text:
You’ll spend seven days—from Monday
through Sunday—raising a Snorlax each
week by building up its Strength as you
carry out sleep research. But when the
week is over, it will be time to say
goodbye to that Snorlax, move to a new
research site, and find a new Snorlax
to help with your studies.
HomeScene_FieldChangeDialog_Doctor_1:
Nice work this week! Looks like
you're getting more and more
used to doing research here.
HomeScene_FieldChangeDialog_Doctor_2:
Now, alas, it’s time to say
goodbye to this Snorlax! We’ve
got to pick the next week's site.
HomeScene_FieldChangeDialog_Player_1:
Take care, Snorlax! Thanks for a
great week of snoozy studies!

with Pokémon Sleep will be lost.

HomeScene_ElectricTypeWeek_BannerPopup_T:
The �｣Electric Type Week��＀ event lasts from
4:00 a.m. on Monday, March 11, to 3:59 a.m.
on Monday, March 18 in all areas!

To prepare for the Raikou Research event—
during which Electric-type Pokémon will be
particularly helpful—we encourage you to
befriend lots of Electric-type Pokémon!

During this event, you’ll be able to meet
�｣Pokémon of various sleep types��＀ regardless of
your own. �｣Electric-type Pokémon��＀ will be more
likely to appear.

Also, during this event only, you’ll be able to
use the �｣Mini Candy Boost��＀ function, which
doubles the effect of Pokémon Candies. It’s a
great opportunity to raise your Electric-type
Pokémon!

And during this week-long event, �｣one of the
Pokémon��＀ that visits during sleep research will
�｣for sure��＀ arrive �｣hungry��＀!
Note: This applies to only one sleep session
per day.
This effect applies separately from the hungry
effects of Friend Incense and the
Good Camp Ticket.

In addition, you can get great rewards—like
�｣Dedenne Incense��＀—through �｣limited-time
missions��＀ during the event.

We hope you’re looking forward to this!

• How to Progress in the Event
Participating in the event is easy!
Simply tap the “Sleep” button during the event
period to track your sleep.
A variety of event-related effects will be
triggered during your sleep research.
Note: Event bonuses can be triggered in any
area for this event.
The effects described below will apply during
the event.

— All Days (3/11 to 3/17) —
• During sleep research, �｣one Pokémon��＀ will �｣for
sure be hungry��＀.
• �｣A few Pokémon of different sleep types will
appear��＀ during sleep research regardless of the
researcher’s sleep type for that day.
• �｣Certain Pokémon will be more likely to appear
��＀during sleep research.

• Pokémon that are easier to encounter during
the event
During the event, the following Pokémon
will be more likely to appear!

Greater Appearance Rate
Pikachu, Raichu, Jolteon, Pichu, Mareep,
Flaaffy, Ampharos, Dedenne

For more details about the event, please see
the in-game News.
HomeScene_Valentine_BannerPopup_Text_1:
During the week-long event, �ｵSnorlax’s
requested dishes will be set to “Desserts/
Drinks,” and the final Strength value for dishes
will be multiplied by 1.5��＀.
Note: The multiplier for Extra Tasty dishes will
be different depending on the day. On Sunday,
Extra Tasty dishes will give 4.5 times as much
Strength, and on the other days, it will give
3 times as much.
HomeScene_Valentine_BannerPopup_Text_2:
Also, �ｵyou’ll be able to meet Pokémon of various
sleep types��＀ regardless of your own.
In particular, �ｵBulbasaur, Jigglypuff, Slowpoke,
Pinsir, Chikorita, and Absol��＀—all Pokémon who
gather ingredients perfect for Valentine’s
Day—will be �ｵmore likely to appear��＀.
You may even meet a Shiny Bulbasaur,
Jigglypuff, Slowpoke, Pinsir, Chikorita,
or Absol!

Through �ｵlimited-time missions��＀ during the
event, you can get great rewards such as
�ｵ10 Poké Biscuits��＀.

And right when this event begins, �ｵtwo new
Dessert/Drink recipes will be added��＀!
Try various combinations of ingredients to
discover these new recipes!
We hope you’re looking forward to it!

HomeScene_NewYear2024_BannerPopup_Text_1:
Beginning at 4:00 a.m. on Monday, January 1,
we will be holding an event in all areas:
�ﺎ￿New Year 2024��＀!
HomeScene_NewYear2024_BannerPopup_Text_2:
New Year 2024 is a week-long event to
celebrate the beginning of the new year.
During the event, you can get �ﺎ￿1.5 times��＀ the
usual Sleep EXP. Also, if you track your
sleep every day during the event, you can
get �ﺎ￿a total of 2,024 bonus sleep points��＀.

You’ll be able to meet Pokémon of �ﺎ￿different
sleep types��＀ regardless of your own, and some
Pokémon such as Bulbasaur, Charmander, and
Squirtle will be �ﺎ￿more likely to appear��＀.

It’s easy to let our sleep become inconsistent
at this time of year, but we hope you and your
helper Pokémon can start off your year with
good sleep consistency!
We hope you’re looking forward to the event!

HomeScene_Holiday_BannerPopup_Text_1:
Beginning at 4:00 a.m. on Monday, December 18,
we will be holding an event on �퍩￿Greengrass Isle��＀:
�퍩￿Holiday 2023 — Double Dream Shard Research��＀!
Holiday 2023 — Double Dream Shard Research is
a week-long event during which you can get
�퍩￿double the Dream Shards��＀ through sleep
research, and you may even meet a Shiny
Pokémon!
There will also be an event-limited function
called �퍩￿Candy Boost��＀, which will give your
Pokémon twice the effect from candies!
The main skill �퍩￿Dream Shard Magnet S will be
twice as effective��＀ as well during the event,
so this is an opportunity to really raise up your
Pokémon!
HomeScene_Holiday_BannerPopup_Text_2:
In addition, the Snorlax on Greengrass Isle
during the event week will have �퍩￿Rawst Berries��＀
(Ice type) set as one of its favorite Berries.
And for this event as well, you’ll be able to
meet Pokémon of �퍩￿different sleep types��＀
regardless of your own!
Through�퍩￿ limited-time missions��＀ during the
event, you can get great rewards such as up to
�퍩￿a total of 60 Pikachu candies��＀.
Also, researchers who conduct sleep research
on the final day of the event will get a gift of
�퍩￿1,225 bonus sleep points��＀!
On top of that, you’ll have a higher likelihood
of meeting �퍩￿Pokémon such as Delibird, Snover,
and Abomasnow��＀, as well as �퍩￿a Pikachu wearing a
red hat��＀!
We hope you’re looking forward to the event!

helper Pokémon!

HomeScene_EeveeWeek_BannerPopup_Text_9:
For more details about the event, please see
the in-game News.
HomeScene_Halloween_BannerPopup_Text_1:
Beginning at 4:00 a.m. on Monday, October 30,
we will be holding an event:
�맿ＯHalloween 2023 — Double Candy Research��＀!
HomeScene_Halloween_BannerPopup_Text_2:
Trick or treat!
During the week-long event, “Halloween 2023 —
Double Candy Research,” you’ll be able to
encounter Pokémon of various sleep types,
regardless of your own sleep type.
Also, you can get lavish rewards, such as a total
of �맿ＯHandy Candy S ×25��＀ through special missions
that will be added to the usual missions, and
you can get �맿Ｏat least � times the usual number
of Pokémon candies��＀ from sleep research.
Try to get lots of candies during this event!
And this time you’ll have lots of opportunities
to meet �맿ＯPikachu wearing a Halloween hat��＀ and
also �맿ＯGhost-type Pokémon such as Gastly��＀!
We hope you’re looking forward to it!
HomeScene_Halloween_BannerPopup_Text_3:
• How to Progress in the Event
Participating in the event is easy!
Simply tap the “Sleep” button on
�맿ＯGreengrass Isle��＀ before going to sleep during
the event period to track your sleep.
A variety of event-related effects will be
triggered during your sleep research.
Note: Tracking sleep on any map other than
Greengrass Isle will not trigger the event
bonuses. The effects described below will apply
during the event period.
HomeScene_Halloween_BannerPopup_Text_4:
�맿ＯHalloween (October 31) and last day of the
event (November 5)��＀
• Researchers will gain �맿Ｏ� times the usual
number of candies��＀ for the first sleep research
of the day
• �맿ＯMany Pokémon of different sleep types will
appear��＀ during sleep research regardless of the
researcher’s sleep type for that day
• �맿ＯCertain Pokémon will be more likely to appear
��＀during sleep research
HomeScene_Halloween_BannerPopup_Text_5:
�맿ＯOther days (October 30 and November 1−4)��＀
• Researchers will gain �맿Ｏ� times the usual
number of candies��＀ for the first sleep research
of the day
• �맿ＯA few Pokémon of different sleep types will
appear��＀ during sleep research regardless of the
researcher’s sleep type for the day
• �맿ＯCertain Pokémon will be more likely to appear
��＀during sleep research
HomeScene_Halloween_BannerPopup_Text_6:
• Pokémon that are easier to encounter during
the event
During the event period, the following Pokémon
will be more likely to appear!

HomePowerRecoveryPopup_BoxEnergy_Text_1:
All Pokémon in your Pokémon Box will
recover Energy equal to 5% of your sleep
score.
HomePowerRecoveryPopup_BoxEnergy_Text_1_:
This does not apply to Pokémon currently
on your team.

If you are using Recovery Incense, the
amount recovered will be equal to 10% of
your sleep score.

Adjustments to Energy recovery based on
individual Pokémon Natures will be applied
separately.

your Snorlax from before you moved.
